I will continue my work to bring this bipartisan bill up for a vote. We must uphold our promise to military families, and I urge members of both parties to support this legislation.

That’s why I support the Military Widow’s Tax Elimination Act, to provide the spouses of service members who give the ultimate sacrifice in the line of duty with the full benefits and financial assistance to which they’re entitled.

We can never repay the debt we owe our servicemen and women who give their lives for our country. It is, however, our responsibility to ensure that their families have the support they need and deserve in the wake of such tragic loss.

As Special Counsel Mueller wrote: “The Russian government interfered in the 2016 presidential election in sweeping and systematic fashion.” We cannot allow this to happen again. This wasn’t merely a couple of Facebook ads: this was an attack on our democracy.

President Trump & Republican leaders need to end their obsession with interfering in women’s health care, and more Republicans need to stand with us. Our message is clear: Women's health care decisions are between them and their doctors.
For thousands of women in New Hampshire, particularly low income women, their family planning visits to Planned Parenthood may be their only doctor's appointment all year.

Today, I joined Planned Parenthood President @DrLeanaWen to discuss the pivotal role that @PPFA plays in delivering necessary, quality care to women and families, including birth control services, cervical cancer screenings, breast exams and substance use disorder screening. pic.twitter.com/PyHWHvnCvt

On May 3, the Trump administration's domestic gag rule goes into effect, which will deprive New Hampshire family planning clinics of millions of dollars in funding that help them provide vital health services.

President Trump and Republicans are relentlessly trying to deny women access to reproductive health care. In recent months, we’ve seen an alarming increase in fear mongering & policies that deny women their reproductive rights.

It’s critical that we support policies that combat the serious threat of climate change and act to promote sustainable solutions that safeguard the environment. The impacts will continue to grow if we continue to do nothing.

In NH, the effects of climate change are already causing serious damage, as shown by rising sea levels on NH’s Seacoast, the loss of trees and moose in our forests, and the erosion of the tourist industry, which is the livelihood of hundreds of thousands of Granite Staters.

While the President has worked to weaken clean air and water protections, Republicans in Congress have chosen to politicize any actions that would help reverse the effects of climate change. https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2019/03/27/gops-answer-catastrophic-climate-change-trolling-libs/?utm_term=.2870c9a83a02 …

Yet, in spite of the overwhelming science that points to the serious and growing threat climate change poses, the Trump administration and Republican leadership continue to willfully ignore evidence and instead promote climate denial.
On #EarthDay, we’re reminded of the responsibility we have to preserve and protect the planet for future generations.

Striking down the ACA would have a catastrophic impact on NH. We cannot afford to turn a blind eye to the Trump admin’s efforts to sabotage the law. As a member of the Senate Armed Services and Appropriations Committees, I’ll always fight on behalf of the Shipyard and the Granite Staters serving there each and every day.

Securing – and protecting – resources for the ongoing projects at the Portsmouth Naval Shipyard will continue to be a top priority for me, particularly as the Trump administration continues to threaten funding that has already been signed into law.

The 2018 Portsmouth Naval Shipyard economic impact report reaffirms what we already know about the Seacoast’s single largest employer: the Shipyard is immensely important to our regional workforce, economy and our nation’s security.

Congratulations to Katie Bouman, who first developed the algorithm that made yesterday’s first-ever image of a black hole possible. Further proof that women in STEM fields can change the world and expand humanity’s understanding of the cosmos.

Couldn’t agree more with Angelina Jolie. Afghan women must have a seat at the table in peace negotiations, as these talks will decide their future. This must be a foreign policy priority of the United States. https://twitter.com/TIME/status/1116051675658293248 …
Secretary Pompeo and the Trump administration must uphold the United States’ commitment to including women in peace negotiations, as required by the law I wrote – the Women, Peace and Security Act.

The Secretary’s assertion that it is somehow up to Afghan women to let themselves into a negotiation controlled by the U.S. and the Taliban is nonsensical and ignorant of the extreme abuses that Afghan women once suffered under Taliban rule. https://twitter.com/SenatorShaheen/status/1116070384963674112 …

Secretary Pompeo’s refusal to commit to including Afghan women in U.S.-led negotiations with the Taliban is a moral and foreign policy failure for this administration. Afghan women should be able to shape their country and the laws they live under. pic.twitter.com/LoLxepCziv

When girls are educated & empowered, we see the ripple effect in the development of their communities & success of their economies. That’s why today I reintroduced the Keeping Girls in School Act to prioritize the education & protection of girls through results-based programs.

130 million girls around the world are not in school. Breaking down barriers to ensure girls have access to quality education should be both a policy priority and moral obligation for the United States.

NATO enjoys broad bipartisan support in Congress because we too agree with the Secretary General: "It is good to have friends."

Our allies must know that Congress stands firmly on the side of @NATO, and the symbolism of @jensstoltenberg’s speech delivered that message loud and clear. As we face an uncertain world, with mounting aggression from Russia & China, the endurance of the Alliance is fundamental.
I welcome @jensstoltenberg’s address, which is an important opportunity for Congress to demonstrate unwavering support for the @NATO Alliance.

.@RoyaRahmani is the first female ambassador of Afghanistan. She represents the immense progress Afghanistan has made & what is at stake if the U.S. fails to push for Afghan women to be included in negotiations with the Taliban.

Today @RoyaRahmani joins me for @NATO Secretary General @jensstoltenberg’s joint address to Congress. Grateful to have her with me & serve as a reminder for how our Allies came together on 9/12/01 in defense of the U.S. & how far Afghanistan has come from that day. pic.twitter.com/PBGoVngsJo

Thank you, Paul DiGeronimo, for your many years of service as a firefighter and paramedic. Your dedication to the job helped keep the Concord community safe and allowed families to rest a little easier. Wishing you all the best in your well-deserved retirement.

This is an important step forward but it doesn't go far enough. I’ll continue to call for a vote on my bipartisan bill to prevent the delivery of the F-35 aircraft until Turkey abandons its plans to obtain the Russian S-400 air defense system.

I’m glad the administration is heeding the bipartisan call in Congress to delay the transfer of F-35 equipment to Turkey. We need to ensure U.S. military technology and capabilities cannot fall into the hands of the Kremlin. https://twitter.com/Reuters/status/1112787207876698114 …
This is a common-sense approach to make health care more affordable that I encourage both Democrats and Republicans to support so together we can improve health care for all Americans.

Together, the Marketplace Certainty Act, Improving Health Insurance Affordability Act and Reducing Costs for Out-of-Network Services Act will help stabilize the marketplace, lower premiums for middle-class families and combat escalating out-of-pocket health care costs.

Every American should have access to affordable, quality health care. This morning, I introduced a health care affordability package, which includes three pieces of legislation that would reduce health care costs for patients and expand access to critical medical services.
